charts.description: The graph shows the evolution in the number of publications in the Agrifood domain, in the EU (at least one author is affiliated to an EU organization). To view only multi-disciplinary publications, use the filter. Multi-disciplinary publications are characterized as those that fall under at least one other FoS level 3 field in addition to Agrifood. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph

charts.chartName: Share of publications in Agrifood Topics over Time
charts.description: The graph shows the evolution in the share of publications in different topics in the Agrifood domain in the EU, over time. The assignment of topics is taken from Abbate, Centobelli, Cerchione (2023) (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.techfore.2022.122222) which we enhanced and mapped to topics in our Fields of Science (FoS) publication classification system (http://doi.org/10.3389/frma.2023.1149834). Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph

charts.chartName: Open Access publications in Agrifood over time
charts.description: The graph shows the evolution in the number of scientific articles published in Open Access, and in the number of publications (any type) that can be found in Open Access in the OpenAIRE graph (best available access rights from any of the OpenAIRE data sources). Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph

label.name: Scientific articles published in Open Access

charts.description: The graph shows the number of publications in Agrifood by the country of the affiliated organization of an author (with at least one author affiliated to an EU organization). In the case of multiple authors each organization and corresponding country is counted as a separate publication (e.g., one publication with three authors, where two are from Greece and one is from Spain is counted as two publications in Greece and one in Spain). Use the filter on the top right to identify leaders in emerging topics, determined by having consistent growth (half a deviation about the average) for over two years. Publications within ±3 years of the emerging topic identification are mapped accordingly. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph
The graph shows the top 100 organizations in terms of the number of publications in Agrifood with at least one author from an EU organization. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph

The graph shows the number of grant-supported publications in Agrifood with at least one author from an EU organization, by funder (for funders integrated in OpenAIRE). Use the filter on the top right to identify leaders in multidisciplinary or emerging topics. Multidisciplinary publications are those belonging in at least another FoS level 3 field (i.e. Agrifood & at least one more field). Emerging topics are determined by having consistent growth (half a deviation about the average) for over two years. Publications within ±3 years of the emerging topic identification are mapped accordingly. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph

The graph shows the number of publications in Agrifood with at least one author from an EU organization, by UN Sustainable Development Goal (SDG, https://sdgs.un.org/goals). Our SDG classification system uses deep learning techniques to assign a scientific publication to the SDGs that are related to it. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph
The graph shows the top 50 journals by the number of scientific publications in Agrifood, with at least one author from an EU organization. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph

The graph shows the total number of publications, superimposed with the number of those that are cited in patents, over time, using data on publications and patents in the Agrifood domain in the EU. Data Sources: (OpenAIRE Graph, Patstat - EPO dataset).

charts.chartName: Average Citations per Publication over Time
charts.description: The graph shows the average number of citations per scientific publication in the Agrifood domain, with at least one author from an EU organization, over time, by the year of publication. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph using the integrated Open Citations dataset.

The graph shows the total number of citations for scientific publications in Agrifood, with at least one author from an EU organization, over time by the year of publication. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph using the integrated Open Citations dataset.

label.name: Number of scientific publications in agrifood domain

charts.description: The graph shows the evolution of the field-weighted citation index of publications in Agrifood, with at least one author from an EU organization. The index is defined as the average number of citations received over the average number in the same subject in the field world-wide, in a 3-year window. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph using the integrated Open Citations dataset.

The graph shows the average number of citations per publication, in Agrifood with at least one author from an EU organization, by the country of the affiliated organization of an author. In the case of multiple authors each organization and corresponding country is counted as a separate publication (e.g., one publication with three authors, where two are from Greece and one is from Spain is counted as two publications in Greece and one in Spain). Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph using the integrated Open Citations dataset.

The graph shows the top 100 organizations in terms of the average number of citations per publication in Agrifood with at least one author from an EU organization. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph using the integrated Open Citations dataset.

The graph shows citations per publication for grant-supported publications, by funder (for funders integrated in OpenAIRE), in Agrifood with at least one author from an EU organization. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph using the integrated Open Citations dataset.

charts.chartName: Publications Cited in Patents by Topic in Agrifood
charts.description: The graph shows the number of publications cited in patents by topic within the Agrifood domain, both publications and patents are limited to the in the Agrifood domain in the EU. The assignment of topics is taken from Abbate, Centobelli, Cerchione (2023) (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.techfore.2022.122222/) which we enhanced and mapped to topics in our Fields of Science (FoS) publication classification system (http://doi.org/10.3389/frma.2023.1149834/). Data Sources: OpenAIRE Graph, Patstat - EPO dataset.

charts.chartName: Publications cited in patents by SDG
charts.description: The graph shows the number of publications cited in patents by UN Sustainable Development Goal (SDG, https://sdgs.un.org/goals), both publications and patents are limited to the Agrifood domain in the EU. Our SDG classification system uses deep learning techniques to assign a scientific publication to the SDGs that are related to it. Data Sources: OpenAIRE Graph, Patstat - EPO dataset.

label.name: Publications cited in patents by SDG

charts.chartName: Citations per publication by topic in Agrifood
charts.description: The graph shows the average number of citations per scientific publication for different topics in the Agrifood domain. The assignment of topics is taken from Abbate, Centobelli, Cerchione (2023) (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.techfore.2022.122222) which we enhanced and mapped to topics in our Fields of Science (FoS) publication classification system (http://doi.org/10.3389/frma.2023.1149834). Data Sources: OpenAIRE Graph using the integrated Open Citations dataset.

The graph shows the average number of citations per scientific publication in Agrifood, by UN Sustainable Development Goal (SDG, https://sdgs.un.org/goals). Our SDG classification system uses deep learning techniques to assign a scientific publication to the SDGs that are related to it. Data Sources: OpenAIRE Graph using the integrated Open Citations dataset.**

charts.chartName: Comparative Impact of Emerging Scientific Topics
charts.description: This chart compares emerging scientific topics based on publication volume, citation impact, and patent citations, providing insights into their relative influence and industry interest. Emerging topics are determined by having consistent growth (half a deviation about the average) for over two years. Publications within ±3 years of the emerging topic identification are mapped accordingly.

The graph shows the evolution in the number of publications in Agrifood with authors affiliated to organizations in at least two different countries, one of which is in the EU. Superimposed is the number of those that are cited by at least one publication. Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph using the integrated Open Citations dataset.

The graph shows the number of publications with authors affiliated to organizations in at least two different countries, one of which is in the EU, by topic in the Agrifood domain. The assignment of topics is taken from Abbate, Centobelli, Cerchione (2023) (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.techfore.2022.122222/) which we enhanced and mapped to topics in our Fields of Science (FoS) publication classification system (http://doi.org/10.3389/frma.2023.1149834). Data Source: OpenAIRE Graph**

The graph shows the average number of authors, i.e. the collaboration index, in publications in Agrifood by UN Sustainable Development Goal (SDG, https://sdgs.un.org/goals). Our SDG classification system uses deep learning techniques to assign a scientific publication to the SDGs that are related to it. The size of the bubble indicates the number of publications associated with that SDG. Data Source:OpenAIRE Graph

The graph presents the number of Agrifood patents granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2, by their respective priority years. To identify Agrifood-related patents in the EU, we initially conducted a comprehensive selection process using predefined patent categories. Subsequently, we matched CPC (Cooperative Patent Classification) codes to Agrifood topics (as described in Abbate, Centobelli, and Cerchione (2023), https://doi.org/10.1016/j.techfore.2022.122222). Finally, we filtered the patents to include only those where at least one inventor or applicant is affiliated with an EU organization. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset

charts.chartName: Share of Patents in Agrifood Topics over Time
charts.description: The graph shows the evolution in the share of patents in different topics in the Agrifood domain, granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2, where at least one inventor or applicant is affiliated with an EU organization. The topics are taken from Abbate, Centobelli, Cerchione (2023) (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.techfore.2022.122222) which we mapped to CPC codes. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset

The graph shows the number of patents in the Agrifood domain, granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2, where at least one inventor or applicant is affiliated with an EU organization, categorized by the country of the applicant. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset

The graph shows the top 100 organizations of patent applicants in terms of the number of patents in the Agrifood domain, granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2, where at least one inventor or applicant is affiliated with an EU organization. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset

The graph shows the number of patents in the Agrifood domain, granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2, where at least one inventor or applicant is affiliated with an EU organization, categorized by the type of patent applicant. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset

The graph shows the number of patents in the Agrifood domain, granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2, where at least one inventor or applicant is affiliated with an EU organization, categorized by the NACE (Nomenclature of Economic Activities) codes of patents as assigned by PATSTAT. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset

The graph shows the top 20 IPC (International Patent Classification) codes by the number of patents in the Agrifood domain, granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2, where at least one inventor or applicant is affiliated with an EU organization. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset

The graph shows the number of patents by topic in the Agrifood domain, granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2, where at least one inventor or applicant is affiliated with an EU organization. The topics are taken from Abbate, Centobelli, Cerchione (2023) (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.techfore.2022.122222) which we mapped to CPC codes. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset

charts.chartName: Technological Value of Patents over Time
charts.description: The graph shows the evolution in the type of patents in the Agrifood domain, granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2, where at least one inventor or applicant is affiliated with an EU organization. There are four types of patents based on the average number of backward citations (BC) and forward citations (FC) to other patents. Adopters (low FC, high BC), enablers (high FC, high BC), pioneers (high FC, low BC) and mavericks (low FC, low BC), where “low” is defined as below average, and “high” as above average. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset

The graph shows the average number of backward and forward citations to other patents for patents in the Agrifood domain, granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2, where at least one inventor or applicant is affiliated with an EU organization. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset.

charts.chartName: Patents by country and technological value
charts.description: The graph shows the number of patents by country for different types of patents in the Agrifood domain, granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2, where at least one inventor or applicant is affiliated with an EU organization. There are four types of patents based on the average number of backward citations (BC) and forward citations (FC) to other patents. Adopters (low FC, high BC), enablers (high FC, high BC), pioneers (high FC, low BC) and mavericks (low FC, low BC), where “low” is defined as below average, and “high” as above average. Use the filter on the top right to change the type selection. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset

charts.chartName: Patents by Organization (top 100) and technological value
charts.description: The graph shows the top 100 organizations by the number of patents for different types of patents in the Agrifood domain, granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2, where at least one inventor or applicant is affiliated with an EU organization. There are four types of patents based on the average number of backward citations (BC) and forward citations (FC) to other patents. Adopters (low FC, high BC), enablers (high FC, high BC), pioneers (high FC, low BC) and mavericks (low FC, low BC), where “low” is defined as below average, and “high” as above average. Use the filter on the top right to change the type selection. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset

charts.chartName: Patents by Sector and Technological value
charts.description: The graph shows the number of patents by sector for different types of patents in the Agrifood domain, granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2, where at least one inventor or applicant is affiliated with an EU organization. There are four types of patents based on the average number of backward citations (BC) and forward citations (FC) to other patents. Adopters (low FC, high BC), enablers (high FC, high BC), pioneers (high FC, low BC) and mavericks (low FC, low BC), where “low” is defined as below average, and “high” as above average. Use the filter on the top right to change the type selection. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset

charts.chartName: Patents by NACE code and by technological value
charts.description: The graph shows the number of patents by NACE (Nomenclature of Economic Activities) code for different types of patents in the Agrifood domain, granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2, where at least one inventor or applicant is affiliated with an EU organization. There are four types of patents based on the average number of backward citations (BC) and forward citations (FC) to other patents. Adopters (low FC, high BC), enablers (high FC, high BC), pioneers (high FC, low BC) and mavericks (low FC, low BC), where “low” is defined as below average, and “high” as above average. Use the filter on the top right to change the type selection. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset.

charts.chartName: Patents by IPC code (top 20 codes) and by technological value
charts.description: The graph shows the top IPC codes by number of patents, for different types of patents in the Agrifood domain, granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2, where at least one inventor or applicant is affiliated with an EU organization. There are four types of patents based on the average number of backward citations (BC) and forward citations (FC) to other patents. Adopters (low FC, high BC), enablers (high FC, high BC), pioneers (high FC, low BC) and mavericks (low FC, low BC), where “low” is defined as below average, and “high” as above average. Use the filter on the top right to change the type selection. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset.

The graph shows the number of patents by topic for different types of patents in the Agrifood domain, granted by the EPO and still valid in 2021-Q2, where at least one inventor or applicant is affiliated with an EU organization. There are four types of patents based on the average number of backward citations (BC) and forward citations (FC) to other patents. Adopters (low FC, high BC), enablers (high FC, high BC), pioneers (high FC, low BC) and mavericks (low FC, low BC), where “low” is defined as below average, and “high” as above average. The topics are taken from Abbate, Centobelli, Cerchione (2023) (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.techfore.2022.122222) which we mapped to CPC codes. Use the filter on the top right to change the type selection. Data Source: Patstat - EPO dataset

charts.chartName: Top Companies by Revenue per Employee
charts.description: The graph showcases the leading Agrifood companies in the EU, ranked according to their revenue per employee. To compile this list, we selected companies from Energy Agrifood Industry Analytics Dataset (Athena Research Center) using Agrifood-related NACE (Nomenclature of Economic Activities) codes. We refined the dataset by employing text mining techniques on their webpages to identify key agrifood terms. To calculate the revenue per employee, we utilized Energy Agrifood Industry Analytics Dataset (Athena Research Center) data by dividing the turnover by the number of employees. Data Source: Energy Agrifood Industry Analytics Dataset (Athena Research Center)

The graph shows the number of companies in Agrifood by EU country. We identified Agrifood companies using related NACE (Nomenclature of Economic Activities) codes, further refining the dataset by employing text mining techniques on company webpages to identify key agrifood terms. Data Source: Energy Agrifood Industry Analytics Dataset (Athena Research Center)

The graph shows the number of companies in Agrifood by NACE (Nomenclature of Economic Activities) code. We identified Agrifood companies using related NACE codes, further refining the dataset by employing text mining techniques on company webpages to identify key agrifood terms. Data Source: Energy Agrifood Industry Analytics Dataset (Athena Research Center)

The graph displays different types of innovative activities carried out by EU Agrifood companies. Data Sources: OpenAIRE Graph, Patstat - EPO dataset, EUIPO, Energy Agrifood Industry Analytics Dataset (Athena Research Center)

charts.chartName: Industry Publications by Year and Topic
charts.description: The graph displays the yearly average number of publications per company, in Agrifood in the EU, by the year and topic of publication. The assignment of topics is taken from Abbate, Centobelli, Cerchione (2023) (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.techfore.2022.122222) which we enhanced and mapped to topics in our Fields of Science (FoS) publication classification system (http://doi.org/10.3389/frma.2023.1149834). Data Sources: OpenAIRE Graph, Energy Agrifood Industry Analytics Dataset (Athena Research Center)

The graph displays the yearly average number of publications per company, in Agrifood in the EU, by SDG. Our SDG classification system uses deep learning techniques to assign a scientific publication to the SDGs that are related to it. Data Sources: OpenAIRE Graph, Energy Agrifood Industry Analytics Dataset (Athena Research Center)

The graph displays yearly average number of publications per company, in Agrifood in the EU, by number of employees. Data Sources: OpenAIRE Graph, Energy Agrifood Industry Analytics Dataset (Athena Research Center)

The graph displays yearly average number of publications per company, in Agrifood in the EU, by country. Data Sources: OpenAIRE Graph, Energy Agrifood Industry Analytics Dataset (Athena Research Center)

charts.chartName: Industry Patents by Year and Topic
charts.description: The graph displays the yearly average number of patents per company, in Agrifood in the EU, by the priority year and topic of patent. The topics are taken from Abbate, Centobelli, Cerchione (2023) (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.techfore.2022.122222) which we mapped to CPC codes. Data Sources: Patstat - EPO dataset, Energy Agrifood Industry Analytics Dataset (Athena Research Center)

The graph displays the yearly average number of patents per company, in Agrifood in the EU, by number of employees. Data Sources: Patstat - EPO dataset, Energy Agrifood Industry Analytics Dataset (Athena Research Center)

The graph displays the yearly average number of patents per company, in Agrifood in the EU, by country. The graph displays the yearly average number of patents per company, in Agrifood in the EU, by country. Data Sources: Patstat - EPO dataset, Energy Agrifood Industry Analytics Dataset (Athena Research Center)
The graph displays the yearly average number of trademarks per company, in Agrifood in the EU, by year. Data Sources: EUIPO, Energy Agrifood Industry Analytics Dataset (Athena Research Center)

The graph displays the yearly average number of trademarks per company, in Agrifood in the EU, by trademark type. Data Sources: EUIPO, Energy Agrifood Industry Analytics Dataset (Athena Research Center)

The graph displays the yearly average number of trademarks per company, in Agrifood in the EU, by number of employees. Data Sources: EUIPO, Energy Agrifood Industry Analytics Dataset (Athena Research Center)
The graph displays the yearly average number of trademarks per company, in Agrifood in the EU, by country. Data Sources: EUIPO, Energy Agrifood Industry Analytics Dataset (Athena Research Center)

This graph shows the evolution in the number of regulations related to the Agrifood sector in the EU over time. Using AI-driven string matching algorithms, 'Agriculture and Fisheries' regulations were extracted from EUR-Lex's in-force metadata. Machine learning techniques further refined the dataset. Data Sources: EUR-Lex

A distribution of regulations categorized by their type. Using AI-driven string matching algorithms, 'Agriculture and Fisheries' regulations were extracted from EUR-Lex's in-force metadata. Machine learning techniques further refined the dataset. Data Sources: EUR-Lex

This graph showcases the contribution of different organizations towards regulatory developments (listed as authors of regulations). Using AI-driven string matching algorithms, 'Agriculture and Fisheries' regulations were extracted from EUR-Lex's in-force metadata. Machine learning techniques further refined the dataset. Data Sources: EUR-Lex

A comprehensive distribution showcasing the number of regulations across various (eurovoc) topics. Using AI-driven string matching algorithms, 'Agriculture and Fisheries' regulations were extracted from EUR-Lex's in-force metadata. Machine learning techniques further refined the dataset. Data Sources: EUR-Lex

This graph presents the number of regulations by their category (subject matter). Using AI-driven string matching algorithms, 'Agriculture and Fisheries' regulations were extracted from EUR-Lex's in-force metadata. Machine learning techniques further refined the dataset. Data Sources: EUR-Lex

charts.chartName: Companies with ESG Reports by Turnover
charts.description: This chart ranks companies, having ESG Reports published, by their turnover. A December 2022 crawl of company websites, verified against Orbis data, identified ESG/Sustainability Reports through PDF analysis, extracting document names and paths. The process provided a dataset from 2006 to 2022, covering around 100 companies. Datasource: Company Websites, Orbis.

label.name: Turnover of Companies with ESG Reports

charts.chartName: Number of Data Points Reported by ESG Scope
charts.description: This chart shows the number of data points reported, categorized by ESG scope. A Data Point is a value for a reported ESG metric in the dataset and it provides the relative information for this metric about a company for a specific year. A December 2022 crawl of company websites, verified against Orbis data, identified ESG/Sustainability Reports through PDF analysis, extracting document names and paths. The process provided a dataset from 2006 to 2022, covering around 150 companies. Data Source: Company Websites, Orbis.

This chart illustrates the most reported ESG metrics, based on coverage percentage. It shows the percentage of ESG reports which disclose relative information about the specific metric. A December 2022 crawl of company websites, verified against Orbis data, identified ESG/Sustainability Reports through PDF analysis, extracting document names and paths. The process provided a dataset from 2006 to 2022, covering around 150 companies. Data Source: Company Websites, Orbis.

This chart highlights the least reported ESG metrics by coverage percentage. It shows the percentage of ESG reports which disclose relative information about the specific metric. A December 2022 crawl of company websites, verified against Orbis data, identified ESG/Sustainability Reports through PDF analysis, extracting document names and paths. The process provided a dataset from 2006 to 2022, covering around 150 companies. Data Source: Company Websites, Orbis.

charts.chartName: Average Share of Non-null Metrics per Report by ESG Scope and Year
charts.description: This chart presents the average share of non-null metrics in ESG reports, segmented by ESG scope and year. A December 2022 crawl of company websites, verified against Orbis data, identified ESG/Sustainability Reports through PDF analysis, extracting document names and paths. The process provided a dataset from 2006 to 2022, covering around 100 companies. Data Source: Company Websites, Orbis.

charts.chartName: Average ESG Score per Company by Scope and Year
charts.description: This chart displays annual performance of an average company based on the data of each year for each scope. For meaningful ESG score comparison, it is suggested to focus on specific years and not on across-years analysis. Filters for categorical/non-categorical metrics can be applied in the analysis. ESG Score is computed by ranking annual metric values, with weights determined by dataset coverage (summing to 1). Final Score is calculated by multiplying weight with ranking. A December 2022 crawl of company websites, verified against Orbis data, identified ESG/Sustainability Reports through PDF analysis, extracting document names and paths. The process provided a dataset from 2006 to 2022, covering around 150 companies. Data Source: Company Websites, Orbis.

charts.chartName: Average ESG Score per Company by Metric and Year
charts.description: This chart displays annual performance of an average company based on the data of each year for each metric. For meaningful ESG score comparison, it is suggested to focus on specific years and not on across-years analysis. Filters for categorical/non-categorical metrics can be applied in the analysis. ESG Score is computed by ranking annual metric values, with weights determined by dataset coverage (summing to 1). Final Score is calculated by multiplying weight with ranking. A December 2022 crawl of company websites, verified against Orbis data, identified ESG/Sustainability Reports through PDF analysis, extracting document names and paths. The process provided a dataset from 2006 to 2022, covering around 150 companies. Data Source: Company Websites, Orbis.

charts.chartName: Annual Distribution of Green Job Posts
charts.description: This visualization showcases the proportion of job postings classified as green over time. The underlying data is sourced from the OJA dataset provided by CEDEFOP, reflecting job requirements for skills across Europe. It has been cross-referenced with ESCO's green occupation classifications and skills framework, ensuring that only postings with at least one green skill are included. Data Source: CEDEFOP OJA dataset, ESCO classification

label.name: Annual Distribution of Green Job Posts

charts.chartName: Share of Green Job Posts per sector
charts.description: This chart shows the share of green job postings across different economic sectors, showcasing which areas are integrating green skills most actively. The evaluation of job posts is based on data from the OJA dataset by CEDEFOP, which details the skill requirements for each job opportunity. This is paired with the ESCO classification to determine whether a job post aligns with recognized green occupations and includes the necessary green skills. Data Source: CEDEFOP OJA dataset, ESCO classification
